title: Get the latest insights for the test run.

rows.Title: Cosmos DB Throttling Under High Load
rows.Insight: Cosmos DB 'sampledb' reached its provisioned RU limit, causing throttling and contributing to increased response times and errors in client requests.
rows.Details: Normalized RU consumption for Cosmos DB rose from 0% at 14:04:40 UTC to 100% by 14:06:00 UTC, correlating with a spike in response times for requests like Get All Lists (peaking at 20190ms by 14:07:40 UTC) and increased errors (400) for Create List Item (peaking at 115 errors by 14:06:30 UTC).
rows.Recommendation: Consider increasing the provisioned RUs for Cosmos DB or enabling autoscale to handle peak loads more effectively.

rows.Summary: The load test ran for ~3 minutes with up to 200 virtual users, generating 12,497 requests at 67 RPS. Server-side metrics showed Cosmos DB RU throttling at 100%, increased HTTP request durations, and high CPU usage (61%) on the app service plan. Backend bottlenecks, including failed HTTP requests and database throttling, impacted performance under load.
